html:
right hand of Moses/his glorious arm. "Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the Lord caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided" (Ex. 14:21). As we learn from Exodus, Moses used the priesthood to divide the waters of the Red Sea. The waters divided not by Moses' power but by the power of God, symbolized in the expression his glorious arm.

everlasting name. The Lord forever established his reputation as a God of supreme power when he led the children of Israel out of Egypt.
